Noida International University (NIU) is a multidisciplinary, research-driven University. The University invites online/offline applications from the eligible candidates for admission to the doctoral (Ph.D.) Programme as per UGC Minimum Standards and Procedures for Awards of Ph.D. Degree Regulations, 2022, published in the Gazette of India on 7th November, 2022.The Ph.D. programme at NIU is a full-time programme and not conducted in distance mode

admission_requirements.summary: Noida International University is inviting applications for its Ph.D. program for the 2025-26 July batch, covering a wide array of disciplines across its various schools including Medical Sciences, Engineering, Liberal Arts, Sciences, Allied Health Sciences, Nursing, Business Management, Journalism, Law, Education, and Fine Arts. Eligibility requires a Master's degree with at least 55% marks (or equivalent), with relaxations for reserved categories. Specific criteria apply for candidates with a 4-year Bachelor's degree or an M.Phil. degree. The application process involves submitting a form with a fee of Rs. 1122/- online via the university website (www.niu.edu.in). Admission will be based on an entrance test and interview, with exemptions for certain fellowship holders and M.Phil. graduates from the entrance test.
admission_requirements.raw_content:
Applications are invited for Ph.D. programme (2025-26, July Batch) in the following schools:
• Noida International Institute of Medical Sciences (NIIMS): Anatomy, Medical Biochemistry, Physiology, Pathology.
• School of Engineering & Technology (SET): Mechanical Engineering, Computer Science Engineering, Biotechnology, Civil Engineering.
• School of Liberal Arts (SLA): History, International Relations, Public Administration, English, Political Science, Geography, Psychology, Sociology.
• School of Sciences (SOS): Biotechnology & Microbiology, Computer Sciences & Information Technology, Physics, Chemistry, Mathematics, Agriculture.
• School of Allied Health Sciences (SOAHS): Public Health, Physiotherapy, Medical Laboratory Technology
• School of Nursing (SON): Nursing.
• School of Business Management (SBM): General Management, Marketing & International Business, HR, Economics & Finance.
• School of Journalism & Mass Communication (SJMC): Advertising/Public Relations/Print Media/Mass Communication/Development Communication/Radio Communication.
• School of Law & Legal Affairs (SLLA): Mercantile Law/Human Rights/Commercial Law.
• School of Education (SOE): Educational Philosophy/Educational Psychology/Educational Sociology and School Administration.
• School of Fine Arts (SFA): Visual Arts.
• 1-year/2-semester master’s degree programme after a 4-year/8-semester bachelor’s degree programme or a 2-year/4-semester master’s degree programme after a 3-year bachelor’s degree programme or qualifications declared equivalent to the master’s degree by the corresponding statutory regulatory body, with at least 55% marks in aggregate or its equivalent grade in a point scale wherever grading system is followed or equivalent qualification from a foreign educational institution accredited by an assessment and accreditation agency which is approved, recognized or authorized by an authority, established or incorporated under a law in its home country or any other statutory authority in that country to assess, accredit or assure quality and standards of the educational institution.A relaxation of 5% marks or its equivalent grade may be allowed for those belonging to SC/ST/OBC (non-creamy layer)/Differently-Abled, Economically Weaker Section (EWS) and other categories of candidates as per the decision of the Commission from time to time.Provided that a candidate seeking admission after a 4-year/8-semester bachelor’s degree programme should have a minimum of 75% marks in aggregate or its equivalent grade on a point scale wherever the grading system is followed. A relaxation of 5% marks or its equivalent grade may be allowed for those belonging to SC/ST/OBC (non-creamy layer)/Differently-Abled, Economically Weaker Section (EWS) and other categories of candidates as per the decision of the Commission from time to time.
• Candidates who have completed the M.Phil. programme with at least 55% marks in aggregate or its equivalent grade in a point scale wherever grading system is followed or equivalent qualification from a foreign educational institution accredited by an assessment and accreditation agency which is approved, recognized or authorized by an authority, established or incorporated under a law in its home country or any other statutory authority in that country to assess, accredit or assure quality and standards of educational institutions, shall be eligible for admission to the Ph.D. programme. A relaxation of 5% marks or its equivalent grade may be allowed for those belonging to SC/ST/OBC (non-creamy layer)/Differently-Abled, Economically Weaker Section (EWS) and other categories of candidates as per the decision of the Commission from time to time.
Forms are available on the university website (www.niu.edu.in), which can be submitted along with Online Payment or Demand Draft of Rs. 1122/-. All applications must be submitted online. The applicant can download a copy of the submitted application form from the application submission portal and furnish hardcopy of the application form with photograph and all the documentary evidence in original (testimonials, certificates, publications, work experience and research/professional experience) at the time of interview.
Incomplete applications will be rejected.
Admission to PhD. Program shall be based on merit obtained in entrance test and interview.
The students who have qualified UGC-NET with JRF / UGC-CSIR-NET with JRF / teacher fellowship holder or any other Government / Foreign research fellowship holder or have passed M.Phil. Programme (as per UGC Regulations 2009 or amended thereafter) with course work shall be exempted from the entrance test but they have to appear in the interview.

entrance_exam_details.summary: This document outlines the structure and evaluation criteria for an examination, likely for a postgraduate or research program. The exam consists of two papers, Paper-I and Paper-II, each worth 50 marks and lasting one hour. Paper-I covers Research Methodology and Aptitude, while Paper-II focuses on Subject Specific content aligned with UGC/CSIR NET syllabi. Both papers have a 50% weightage. The entrance test itself is qualifying with a 50% pass mark. The final merit list is determined by combining the entrance test score (70% weightage) with interview marks (30% weightage). The interview performance is assessed based on competence for research, suitability of the plan, and novelty of the plan, each contributing 10 marks.
